John Erik Halse writes:
> +1 for both!
> I suggest that Michael's approach should be used if no encoding is
> explicitly set by the user.

I've been thinking about this some more. The System property
file.encoding may not be what we want, without adding more logic to
the mix. For example, on an English Solaris 2.8 system the property is
ISO646-US, which is a subset of ISO 8859-1, the de facto default for
HTTP. On a RedHat 7.3 system the POSIX locale specifies
"ANSI_X3.4-1968"...

This may be OK, or it may not be. For now I'd be most comfortable
making the 'default' value 'ISO-8859-1'.

    -tree
